title: 23.4 Institutional Affiliation (pp. 251–52)

meta.description: Generations of law students, lawyers, scholars, judges, and other legal professionals have relied on The Bluebook's unique system of citation in their…

body_html:
23.4 Institutional Affiliation (pp. 251–52)

When a document was prepared for a particular institution (e.g., a government agency, a company, or a nonprofit) and is not archived with that institution, add an institutional affiliation into the citation for clarity. Abbreviate according to tables T6, T7, T10, and T13. However, do not omit “in” or “of”:

Kristof Zeitman, Report on the Feasibility of a Reversible Tourbillion Movement, Jaegar LeCoultre SA 28 (1993) (on file with Am. Horological Archive, Foreign Horology Collection, Box 2, Folder 1).

This rule does not apply to Justices’ papers (rule 23.7.1) or other courts’ papers (rule 23.7.2(b)).
